STM: Struggling with Intro to Comp Sci class, feeling overwhelmed by coding assignments.
Attended Writing the Essay class, questioning its relevance to future career needs.

MTM.Summary: Struggling with the transition from high school to college level coursework.
MTM.Patterns: Overwhelmed by assignments, questioning class relevance, difficulty with coding
MTM.Goals: Improve coding skills, find relevance in coursework, manage workload
MTM.Transition: Adjusting to higher academic expectations and workload.

LTM.Milestone: Started college education, marking transition to higher academics.
LTM.Implications: Beginning of professional development and career exploration.
LTM.Lessons: Academic rigor increase, adaptation needed, new study habits required

short_term: Seek mentorship for better coursework understanding
long_term: Continue academic excellence for graduate opportunities

STM: Made a couple of friends in class, finding some comfort in new connections.
Feeling disconnected from high school friends, reflecting on how quickly life changes.
Awkward interactions with roommate and classmates; social life feels forced or inauthentic.

MTM.Summary: Navigating new social dynamics and relationships in college.
MTM.Patterns: Forming new friendships, feeling disconnected from old friends, awkward interactions
MTM.Goals: Foster genuine connections, reconcile with changes in old relationships, improve social interactions
MTM.Transition: Adapting to the social aspects of college life.

short_term: Join clubs or groups to meet like-minded peers
Organize regular meetups with old friends
Attend social events to improve interaction skills
long_term: Balance personal time with relationship building

STM: Struggling with the adjustment to college life, experiencing existential crises and questioning life plans.
Dealing with the noise and unpredictability of city life affecting personal space and sleep.

MTM.Summary: Dealing with the psychological and physical adjustments to college life.
MTM.Patterns: Existential crises, sleep disturbances, city life adjustment
MTM.Goals: Find balance, seek mental peace, adapt to urban environment
MTM.Transition: Learning to manage mental health in a new environment.

short_term: Engage in physical activities to reduce stress
Seek counseling or peer support groups
long_term: Create a sustainable lifestyle for mental and physical health
Explore mindfulness and stress management techniques
Maintain a consistent health check-up schedule

STM: Concerned about money, especially after buying an expensive coffee, missing cheaper home options.

MTM.Summary: Confronting financial realities as a college student.
MTM.Patterns: Concerns over spending, missing cheaper options from home
MTM.Goals: Budget effectively, understand financial implications of choices
MTM.Transition: Becoming aware of the costs associated with independence.

short_term: Create and adhere to a monthly budget
Look for part-time jobs or scholarships
Learn about student financial aid options
long_term: Save for future educational or professional investments

STM: Pondering the authenticity of happiness and social interactions in college environment.
Reflecting on the contrast between expectations of college life and the reality of constant work and existential pondering.

MTM.Summary: Questioning the authenticity of experiences and expectations in college.
MTM.Patterns: Reflecting on happiness, pondering life plans, contrasting expectations with reality
MTM.Goals: Define personal values, reconcile expectations, seek genuine experiences
MTM.Transition: Grappling with philosophical changes in worldview.

short_term: Engage in philosophical discussions or join a philosophy club
Journal regularly to track personal growth
long_term: Develop a personal philosophy or life creed
Integrate philosophical insights into daily life
Pursue studies or readings in existentialism or ethics

STM: Expressing frustration with coding, particularly with Java, indicating a steep learning curve in tech education.

MTM.Summary: Experiencing the steep learning curve associated with computer science.
MTM.Patterns: Frustration with coding, difficulty with Java
MTM.Goals: Master coding concepts, overcome technical challenges
MTM.Transition: Adjusting to the demands of tech education.

short_term: Complete coding projects for practical experience
Get familiar with more programming languages
long_term: Become proficient in multiple programming paradigms
Keep up with emerging technologies and trends
